intro: Ficus flavovenia, commonly known as the golden fig or yellow-veined fig, is a species of flowering plant in the Moraceae family. It is native to parts of Southeast Asia, including Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves that often have a distinct yellow or golden vein pattern. Ficus flavovenia produces small, greenish-white flowers followed by edible figs that are typically small and sweet. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and ease of care.
